block.p: Amy Lou Busch, a daughter of Paula Busch of New York and the late Charles Busch, was married yesterday to Kevin John Cameron, the son of Cathleen Cameron and Dr. John Cameron of Bloomington, Ind. Carolyn Patierno, a seminarian at the Pacific School of Religion, officiated at the Andretti Winery in Napa, Calif.

Ms. Busch, 28, is keeping her name. She graduated from Harvard University and is a doctoral candidate in clinical psychology at the University of California at Berkeley. Her father was a stockbroker for Oppenheimer & Company in New York. Her mother manages the Bristol Plaza, an apartment hotel in New York.

Amy Lou Busch, a daughter of Paula Busch of New York and the late Charles Busch, was married yesterday to Kevin John Cameron, the son of Cathleen Cameron and Dr. John Cameron of Bloomington, Ind. Carolyn Patierno, a seminarian at the Pacific School of Religion, officiated at the Andretti Winery in Napa, Calif.

Ms. Busch, 28, is keeping her name. She graduated from Harvard University and is a doctoral candidate in clinical psychology at the University of California at Berkeley. Her father was a stockbroker for Oppenheimer & Company in New York. Her mother manages the Bristol Plaza, an apartment hotel in New York.

Mr. Cameron, 31, is a vice president and the deputy general counsel of the NorthPoint Communications Group, a San Francisco service provider for high-speed Internet access. He graduated from McGill University and received a law degree from the University of Chicago. His father directs the Indiana University cyclotron facility, a nuclear research center in Bloomington.
